result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daneen M Pope

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 093159,
Payable Number: 1035849,
Receipt Number: 22RP039308,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Daneen M Pope in court.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. in court for Daneen M Pope.  Attorney Matthew Richard Westphal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Parties is awaiting Co-defendant matter in case 22CF2032 to have a preliminary hearing to determine case posture. State requested an adjournment. No objection from defense. Court adjourns matter for a status conference in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Morgan in court in person.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Michael Anthony Morgan.  Attorney Matthew Richard Westphal in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense motions that the defendant is attempting to hire private counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daneen M Pope in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense in negotiation status and requested adjournment.  Co-defendant scheduled for prelim August 24, 2022.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daneen M Pope in court with Attorney Richard L. Voss.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court scheduling conference.   The scheduling conference was held in person.  The parties requests an additional status conference.  The Court will grant the parties request and adjourn the matter to branch 25.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michael A.M. (co-defendant), Milwaukee County Child Support Services employees, except for addressing her own child support.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 25, Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 25.

Defendant Daneen M Pope in court with attorney Matthew Richard Westphal.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Franke, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/15/22 @ 1p
